I believe this PR is a small step in that direction, and helps simplify concurrent PRs. In the future sample_shape should default to ().

 In torch/distributions.py
 <#4100 (comment)>:

 > @@ -53,9 +55,9 @@ class Distribution(object):
      Distribution is the abstract base class for probability distributions.
      """

 -    def sample(self):
 +    def sample(self, n=None):

 wasn't the plan to accept shape tuples instead of a single number?

body:
I believe this PR is a small step in that direction, and helps simplify
concurrent PRs. In the future sample_shape should default to ().

On Dec 9, 2017 10:13 PM, "Adam Paszke" <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> *@apaszke* commented on this pull request.
> ------------------------------
>
> In torch/distributions.py
> <https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/4100#discussion_r155939259>:
>
> > @@ -53,9 +55,9 @@ class Distribution(object):
>      Distribution is the abstract base class for probability distributions.
>      """
>
> -    def sample(self):
> +    def sample(self, n=None):
>
> wasn't the plan to accept shape tuples instead of a single number?
>
> —
